title: which one seems better?
content:
I am creating a monogram for the name Pragya. Pragya is a graphic designer and would like the focus of her work to be on typography and lettering. For now, this monogram/logo will print on her business card in a size of at least 60mm. Which one do you think looks better? Any other feedback/comments are welcome.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [P\_comparison.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317220848/http:/typophile.com/files/P_comparison.jpg) | 51.79 KB |
author: pugga

comments.content: The second is more complete and better balanced.

The elaborate lower curve of the second one distracts a bit from the impact of the nice P. on the other hand the first one looks incomplete. Why not compromise and extend the curve of the first one only to just before it crosses itself?
Is the flowery ornateness appropriate to her graphic design style?
